page.title: 16C. of E. Church
page.content:
Affectionately known as the "Tin Tabernacle" the{Church of England church is a small mission hut, yet people are always surprised how splendid it is inside with wooden panelling and an attractive altar. Services which are held weekly are conducted by the vicar who lives in Hanbury. There is a junior choir who lead the family services and also perform excellent musical entertainment e.g. at the Harvest Suppper.
On Rogation Sunday the congregation are led outside by the vicar to bless the fields. At Christmas time a very large tree is lit during a special open air service. During Christmas the tree is a very cheering sight to motorists coming down the cliff on their way home from work.
